alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 11 at 8:28AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected this weekend. Additional rain and snowmelt next week will keep flows in the Meadow Valley Wash elevated through the end of next week. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nevada, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PDT Friday Mar 17. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Meadow Valley Wash, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall and snowmelt. Low-water crossings will become inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 AM PST, gauge reports indicated the Meadow Valley Wash north of Ursine is rising due to rain and snowmelt. Flooding is expected in the warned area. - This includes the Meadow Valley Wash, plus low lying ares adjacent to the Meadow Valley Wash. - Locations that will experience flooding between Spring Valley State Park and Echo Canyon State Park include...State Route 322, Eagle Valley Road and Rose Valley Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
